newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco's bourse watchdog sets deadline for result.
newsitem.headline: Morocco's bourse watchdog sets deadline for result.

text.p: Morocco's stock exchange watchdog on Monday told companies listed on the Casablanca bourse to publish their annual results by March 31.

The body, Conseil Deontologique des Valeurs Mobilieres (CDVM), in a statement in the daily l'Opinion, asked the firms to publish their results in newspapers approved by the Finance Ministry before the end of March.
CDVM was established in 1994 to regulate trading on the stock exchange and a spokesman said on Monday it had the power to set a deadline for listed companies to publish their results.
Under the law, companies on the exchange are liable to delisting if they do not publish their annual results as stipulated by the CDVM.
The spokesman said 18 firms were delisted in 1995.
